pcd

Class Initializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • pcd.Initializer

  • public class Initializer
extends Object
    Author:
    Tibor Sloboda Prepares missing directories and parses the configuration files, adding missing colors where necessary for cilia types.

    Finally it instantiates ImageDataStorage, which in turn runs the Python process and starts the server. The GUI only opens once Python is connected and loaded.

    • Method Detail

      • splitConfig

        private void splitConfig(ArrayList<String> list)
        Parses lines from the loaded configuration file. It splits the fields of the configuration into respective lists and adds random colors to those types that are missing it.
        Parameters:
        list - The list of lines from the configuration file

      • setup

        void setup()
        Creates missing folders and reads the config file using FileUtils before passing the contents into splitConfig(java.util.ArrayList)

      • run

        void run(String projectFile)
        Initializes the ImageDataStorage and runs the primary GUI. It decides which initializer to use for the GUI based on whether or not a project file was present in passed arguments to main. Finally it adds a listener to the main GUI window to stop the process and exit the program successfully. A System.exit(int) is used to make the program exit once the process is terminated. This is the last line of code in the project, so it is safe from unhandled exceptions.
        Parameters:
        projectFile - The path in String format to any passed project files
        See Also:
        MainFrame
